meanings.definition: An artificial method of increasing the production of oil wells by injecting water into the reservoir.
meanings.sent1: The waterflood helped extract more oil from the well.
meanings.sent2: The engineers implemented a waterflood to enhance oil recovery.
meanings.sent3: The waterflood turned the dry well into a gushing fountain of black gold.
meanings.sent4: The waterflood was like a rejuvenating shower for the oil well.
meanings.sent5: The success of the waterflood was evident in the increased oil output.

meanings.sent1: They decided to waterflood the garden to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: After the heavy rain, the streets were waterflooded.
meanings.sent3: The kids' excitement waterflooded the room when they saw the surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions waterflooded her heart when she heard the touching story.
meanings.sent5: The dam break caused the river to waterflood the entire valley.
